text: CAMERA swoops along a shimmering black sand beach, mounta rising in the further distance... FINDING: in the middle distance: EIGHT WARRIORS galloping HORSEBACK, armed with spears, swords, shields, netting, torches. DOGS race along at their sides. At the head of the troop rides a grizzled mid-aged WARRIO grimly determined, his face obscured by his battle mask. The warriors race on, riding to beat the devil home.

With the sun gone below a ridge of barren hills, the dark is quickly retaking the ground, bleeding out from the crevices of rock, the moss, a stream twisting through the emerald meadow... ++.in the middle distance of which GOATS and SHEEP amble about. Beyond them, rocky outcrops give way to a dark and shifti sea... and the low RUMBLE of surf... Into the foreground there slowly shifts: a huge, stooped FIGURE. Erect, he'd be nearly seven feet tall, and is twi the mass of an average man, covered in hair - much of it greying. Immense arms lead to massive hands, the tough na tools for a brutal existence. His face - or what can be made of it in the falling light has a leatherish quality. It also betrays age, as does a noticeable limp: this is a gigantic nocturnal primate - a troll who has seen better days. He scans the meadow, puzzled. He CLUCKS his tongue a coup of times... GRUNTS out a name of some sort...
Grrruhnellll.... He twists his head to one side, raises his nose and sniff the wind... wary for a moment... then the moment passes.. (CONTINUED)
Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 2.

He shuffles forward a few more steps, still searching, wo now edging in. He CLUCKS his tongue again -- --.and he's slammed from behind by something -- В»-.or, as it turns out, someone: his small child - GREND who promptly tumbles past his father, CACKLING at the pra From the distance comes the sound of a DOG BARKING. The father snatches at Grendel. He misses, tries again, a it becomes a little chase. Finally the father scoops up Grendel and berates him in w several low guttural words - a primitive tongue with echo of Old Norse. Grendel responds by grabbing his father's nose and twisti it, laughing. The father then laughs too. But once again the father grows wary. Holding Grendel clo he sniffs the air. More BARKING DOGS.... ...then the far-off SHOUTS of HUMANS. The father urgently swings Grendel up onto his shoulder, fear overcoming his infirmity - with great strides he cro back out of the meadow toward the rock outcrops.

The troop of warriors race along... +-+-till the lead warrior pulls up, eyeing the rocks to e side. He sniffs the breeze, considers... .--the others waiting on his judgement... ..-then he abruptly jerks his horse toward a break in the rocks, leading up into a meadow... ...the other warriors following.

Grendel's father is moving as best he can... but one hip giving him trouble, and his wind is quickly going on him. Grendel stares back over his shoulder, his face now betra the same fear his father feels. (CONTINUED)
Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 3.
They scramble over rock, twist along moss paths, then dow into a stream... then up the bank, up past massive boulders... the sound of the DOGS and HORSES edging ever closer.

The two trolls emerge into view of the sea. Grendel's fat rushes up to the cliff edge, and verbally/gesturally dire Grendel to descend. Grendel starts down a few feet before turning and meeting father's fierce gaze. He gestures to Grendel to continue down. Grendel does, but steals a glance back up to find.. ..-his father turning to meet their pursuers. Grendel cli back up to the cliffs' edge to see... ...the warriors charging in on horseback. Several dismoun and take positions on the periphery. The lead warrior continues forward. Now we see he's significantly older than the rest; there are years of the sort of battles in him. And yet the fire is still in his - even as it meets the troll's. The other warriors hold back, waiting on their leader's m The troll scowls back, a snarl escaping. The lead warrior, unfazed, even spurred on by the challen charges forward and flings a leather bag at Grendel's fat The bag - hitting - bursts apart, throwing liquid pitch o him. As other warriors rush forward with torches... ...Grendel twists back down into the rocks, terrified. There come the SOUNDS of a vicious FIGHT above.... the RO of his father... the warriors' SHOUTS and the BARKING/WAI of dogs... the NEIGHING, HUFFING and STOMPING of the horses... A dog flies past, over the cliff to the rocks below... Then a sudden WHOOSH... a terrifying SCREECH... ...and Grendel's father staggers off the cliff, stuck wit spears, wrapped in netting, and engulfed in FLAMES. (CONTINUED)
Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 4.

His body twists down, and SLAPS onto the rocks below, whe it lies motionless, burning... until the first wave washe in, extinguishing the flames. Grendel gasps as... ...-TORCHES drop through the air on either side, continui down to the rocks below - the warriors seeking confirmati of the kill. Their CHEERS of celebration wash down over Grendel, and h looks up to see... ...the lead warrior peering down into the dark, a spear raised ready to throw, his figure silhouetted against the torch-lights. What Grendel does not see... .--is the warrior nudge up his battle-mask... REVEALING: the wild battle-eyes of the Danish king - HROT [50]. His ferocious gaze softens, turns to pugzlement. Hrothgar, squinting, makes out... В«--the tiny troll figure of Grendel nestled in the rocks Hrothgar is clearly torn. He gulps in a breath. His hand tightens in grip on his spear, his mind racing. Grendel buries his face in his arms. Finally, Hrothgar's puzzlement shifts to decision. He wip the troll-blood from his eyes. Pity overtakes him. His spear-arm drops... and he turns away. Grendel, burrowed into the rocks, steals a glance up to find... ..-the warrior gone from the cliffside, the sounds of the hunt-party diminishing. But the sound is replaced by Grendel's own sobs.
Grendel comes warily down the stony beach, gaze sweeping about in search, hands dragging an old sword. Finally his gaze falls on what he's been searching for... (CONTINUED)
Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 5.

...the CORPSE of his father washed up in the rocks. He fights back sobs, and struggles to dislodge it... but the corpse is too heavy. He resolves himself, then raises the sword, and swings it down repeatedly onto the corpse's neck. Exhausted and crying, he takes up the severed head - a gr weight for him - and cradles it in his small arms.

ON: the desiccated HEAD of Grendel's father, positioned i erude alcove-shrine, on either side of which small smudge burn... The fires have somewhat preserved the head: the eye socke are empty, and the flesh is gone from the face, but the s has dried and tightened, the long wild hair remains, matt over and beyond the great brow, the yellow teeth clenched eternal grin/grimace... Sea-shells, stones, and dried flowers are placed around t head. REVEAL: Grendel, now an adult, squatting down near a larg fire-bed of embers, gaze fixed on his father's head... hi own thoughts clearly melancholic... A breath rolls through him like a shudder. He rises... ..-revealing his stature: he's huge, with powerful limbs, scale of his father but with none of the infirmity. He starts up a rocky path toward the faint light of the cave entrance...

Grendel emerges out onto the cliff edge, and stares down the crashing water on the rocks below... +--menace rising in his glassy-gaze, he squats down... ...snatches up a fist-sized rock and smashes himself once the forehead... Blood streams down from his brow and across his face. He licks the blood as it reaches his lip. Grunts a bitter SIGH/LAUGH at his wretched state. Blinks through the bloo at... (CONTINUED)
Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 6.
...the sun edging down into the sea. He wipes the blood over his cheeks, chin, brow - a battle mask in the making.

With the light fading from the sky... ...the sounds of a CELEBRATION... LAUGHTER, MUSIC... drif from the village... * A CROWD of VILLAGERS circle about... * В«+-SNORRI [60s] who lifts a blood-stained pine-branch fr the opened chest of a slaughtered ram lying on a rock. * Hrothgar [60s now] goes down on one knee before him. Thou greying, he wears his added years as well as any warrior- could. Snorri touches Hrothgar's forehead with the blood. *

Hrothgar, much-loved King of the Danes, under Odin's eye I blood you lucky on all paths that leave this hall. A CHEER from the crowd. Hrothgar rises, smiling, and turns to his grand hall. His radiant wife - WEALHTHEOW [40s] - hands him a clay ju Hrothgar pulls the cap from it with his teeth and pours w out across the steps. As it splashes down...

May all those who cross these steps find a happy heart! More CHEERS rise up from the villagers... Hrothgar draws his sword and smashes the jug, sealing the blessing... .В»..and as the villagers line up to be - in turn - "bloo by Snorri, Snorri bursting out in resonant SONG... * (CONTINUED)

REVEAL THE LS POV: as that of Grendel, rising over a rock the foreground. His expression is solemn. He sniffs the a deeply. A shudder runs through him at the sound of the song... th rising of a mission in his gaze and in his blood.

With some RAUCOUS drunken ROARS and HOWLS echoing through village... and - at some distance - REVELLERS making thei swerving way back to the longhouse... .-.-a lone torch-lit GUARD moves along a boulder ridge, s in hand, grinning at the drunks. But then an ANIMAL HOWL rises rom the darkness beyond, to which he turns...

Come near here, y'shitbrain wolves, you'll get a mouth of spear. There's movement in the stones below, just beyond the boulders, just out of sight. The guard peers over. Nothing for several beats... but then a strange BREATH-LI sound on the wind...

Speee-arrrr... The guard takes the torch from the holder in the stone, h it out into the darkness, trying to figure what's below. Several small stones hit him in the face, and he jerks ba in surprise.

(wary mutter) What the... The guard throws the torch down into the darkness. Something large deftly shifts out of sight to one side. There's a scratching of nail on stone as something climbs the boulder.
Olaf?! Pal?! The guard swings his spear toward the sound, but without torch he can't see much. Then, again, there's silence. (CONTINUED)
10 11 12 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 8.

The guard moves to the edge, his spear high, ready to sta -.. but from the side a large dark LIMB swings out, the h slapping the guard in the face. The thin CRACK of bone snapping. The guard drops, shudders briefly, then his body goes sti
LIGHT bleeds in with the CREAKY opening of the huge door,

...the night's carnage: broken benches, the BODIES of sev slain warriors... blood splashed about... ANGLE BACK ON: Hrothgar standing, stunned, in the doorway with UNFERTH [30], a sturdy and well-scarred Danish warri to one side and AESCHERE [late 60s], Hrothgar's peer, to other. Hrothgar, with Aeschere at this side, determinedly edges forward over the slippery wood... ....Unferth - hungover and bloodstained - an awkward step behind.
Where were you when all this --
(awkward) Asleep. I'd... I'd... had some beers.
No others saw what happened?
None who can speak.

(through his teeth) What fucking thing would dare -- But his words end, and his steps slow. Hrothgar, stunned, crosses the floor past the dead fire-p to a slumped FIGURE on the throne at the far end of the r (CONTINUED)
12 13 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 9.

It's the guard from the wall, one hand clutching his spea in readiness... his hood hanging over his face. Hrothgar edges up, takes up a spear and, with its point, lifts the guard's hood - gasps - and jerks back. Rolling off the shoulders - where his head should be - is bloody head-sized stone. It hits the floor with a great THUMP, and rolls across it, coming to a stop at Hrothgar' feet. ON: Hrothgar's face, his horror giving way to a grim realization.

CAMERA slowly sweeps over sea-water... coming to rest... ON: BEOWULF [30]... or at least his head, seeming to eeri bob on a plank of wood on the surface of the water. The odd wave splashes over him... his eyes closed, face betraying no life... then suddenly a long SIGH of exhaust and relief... His eyes flicker open, he blinks, and slowly edges in tow land, his neck, shoulders, torso inch-by-inch revealed... ..-watched by a lone FISHERMAN on the beach mending his n Beowulf, delirious, pushes aside the wooden plank, limps onto the sand, trailing seaweed, his shins and thighs burdened by lamprey EELS attached to his flesh... He wears a battle-weathered leather tunic, shredded tweed pants, a baldric-strap tying his sheathed sword to his back... His body, though battered and scarred, is obviously one o great power. His wobbly-kneed stagger still manages the grace of the warrior/athlete returning from a struggle wh nearly killed him.
G'day. (CONTINUED)
13 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 10.
G'day. I'd owe much to know my whereabouts.
Fish Beach... but likely I'm the only one who names it that. (off Beowulf's look / wry) Where I get fish. The fisherman goes to his fire-pit and takes from it a smoking stick.
I mean who's your king? The fisherman looks back across the land, considers it...
Well... y'know how these things go. As he talks, he indicates various directions and movement with his stick...

Late as a couple years ago I think it was a Hathobard. Swedes rolled in, pushed them out... Hathobards came back, pushed them out - then they got pushed out by Geats. Wulfings showed up... (beat / sighs) Sig Skullsplitter of the Hathobards was spilling blood this way last spring. But then he got sick from sleeping with the sheep. Swedes came back...
(hint of worry) It's Swedish land then?
I wouldn't bet a fish on that. Hygelac the Geat then lay a beating on the Swedes... (beat) I had a boatload of Wulfings wash up. But they were just corpses. Stunk to Valhalla. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
13 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 11.

Had to let'm dry out a week then I put the whole little crowd to flame - not knowin what they died of, eh. (beat / shrugs) Yeah, I'll be guessing this is Geat land for now. Beowulf's relief is apparent.
Sleep with that, canya?
Being a Geat... (nods) I'm Beowulf. * By Beowulf's look, it's clear he expects his name to * register, but - just as clearly - it doesn't. *
Beowulf... what, the Eel Meal? The fisherman nods to Beowulf's eel-infested shins. Beowu looks down, gets dizzy and drops to the sand where he sit

You've not had another wash up...? Like myself... name of Breca? The fisherman shakes his head. As Beowulf talks, the fisherman methodically starts poking and singeing the eel with the stick: they unclasp from Beowulf's bloodied fles and drop to the sand, where they squirm till the fisherma whacks them dead.
We were out hunting whale the other day. Storm came up and ate our boat. Breca bet he could beat me to shore. I lost sight of him in the swells. The fisherman tries to fathom this.
So this is just you coming in now? Beowulf nods. The fisherman gives a dubious look.
Y'ever swum in the open sea? (CONTINUED)
13 14 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 12.
Leave that to my boat. Beowulf stares a beat at the fisherman.
Am I right to think you mock me? 13 The fisherman considers Beowulf's grim manner, and his sw He starts to gather the eels and throw them in a pot.
Can't see much life in that. (beat) You do this a lot?
I take what comes.
Good. Then you'll have no qualms if supper tastes like you. Beowulf stares. The fisherman gives a battered-tooth grin
14 The fisherman pokes at his fire while Beowulf nibbles at plate of the cooked eels.
So... what's it like being a hero? Quelling things with axes and that sword of yours... in - what - a kinda bloody madness? Beowulf chafes slightly.
In truth I don't get all that mad.
That's all I've heard of your sort.
You should hear what they say about fishermen. They trade a wry grin. The fisherman stirs the fire.. (CONTINUED)
14 15 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 13.

Beowulf and the fisherman stand before a rack of dried fi The fisherman is packing some in a small pouch, which he hands to Beowulf. Beowulf claps him on the shoulder.
I'm in your debt.
(shrugs) I'm in the fishes'. (grim / to the water) One o' these days they'll come for theirs.

That's uh... not all I do --
No, I'm sure y'piss and shit just like the rest of us. Gotta say there's not much use for that here. (off his look) Hitting things with axes. Y'oughta try Daneland.
Daneland. (CONTINUED)
15 16 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 14.

(dismissive) I'd think the Danes could handle a troll.

(jolted) Eighty?!

(sharp) I know the Danes. They've bloodied seas. The fisherman reads the ferocity of Beowulf's emotion.
Eh, I'm just a fisherman. Beowulf looks out over the water, torn.

Beowulf strides along a sheep trail, crosses over a ridge find... ---a smoldering ruin of a HUT, a few SHEEP about. FIVE ro looking MEN are eating at a fire-pit. He edges forward, eyeing the smoke. They eye him warily. (CONTINUED)
16 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 15.
Dragon came in the night.
(playing surprise) Dragon.
Never heard of dragons?

Oh, I've heard. Just always thought they were tales. (glancing around) And it left without the sheep. (off their looks) Just seems odd... from what I've heard of dragons... to leave a sheep. They offer shrugs.
So who are your people? (off their looks) I know most Geats. And this being Geat land --

What's it to you? Beowulf then spots some movement further back behind a woodpile. His hand slides to the hilt of his sword. The first man fixes on the magnificent hilt - a sword of renown. He eyes Beowulf with more concern.
That's some sword. You have a name?
I don't know yours, you likely won't know mine. Beowulf. The others react - looks shooting amongst them - a name t know and fear. Furtively they reach for their own weapons. (CONTINUED)
16 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 16.

Maybe your dragon came back. And Beowulf edges up the slope toward the shed... ...till he spots a MAN on the ground humping something. As Beowulf nears, he makes out... ...the limp arm of a woman, extended over the rock and on jerking with the thrust of the man. The scenario becomes immediately clear to him: the burned hut, the dead woman. He draws his sword, and directly advances on the bandit group... ...all of whom now brandish weapons - though defensively. The first man stumbles back, his movement putting the lie his words.
Go now, you can go with your life.

This is my life. (ironic mutter) A bloody madness. And he charges forward, swinging his blade... immediately slashing the first man to the ground. A second man comes and, after a couple of traded sword- strokes, Beowulf grabs the other's sword-arm, and then cu him down too. A third man comes at Beowulf, who blocks his sword-swing, grabs the wretch by the throat, and crushes it in his han The last two from the fire-pit group now have clearly panicked expressions. Nonetheless, they come at him with their swords. Beowulf routinely meets their strokes, then snatches hold one, throws him into the other, then decapitates both ina stroke. The headless clutching corpses then shudder to the ground Beowulf turns and marches up the slope. (CONTINUED)
16 17 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 17.

It sails some distance before descending and catching the necrophile in his leg. He tumbles to the ground, SCREAMIN Beowulf strides up to him, pulls his sword from the leg..
(a plea) She was dead!
Yeah. She was. And Beowulf swings his blade down upon the wretch.

Beowulf places the dead woman - wrapped, with care, in a blanket - into a shallow grave. Blood is splattered over his face and clothes, but the wildness has left his eyes: now he looks only weary. The CRACK of a branch behind him, and Beowulf twists abou ready to fight... .--but finds a CHILD [6-7], face tear-streaked, fear in h eyes.
Are you a dragon queller? Beowulf considers, shrugs...
You quell children? Beowulf shakes his head. The child eyes his mother.
She might be scared here with these men.

Then she'll be alone. *

Beowulf comes up over a ridge on foot, leading a HORSE, o which the child sleeps. Beowulf smiles, his gaze finding.

+-+-.a group of tents and SEVERAL DOZEN GEATS, cooking fi sending smoke to the skies, MUSIC and LAUGHTER drifting u the hills. It's an annual gathering place - large standing stones se a great circle, and... В»-.-.across a black beach to the water, A COUPLE of LONG lie at anchor.

With a LONGSHIP silhouetted in the background... ---Beowulf sits almost central at a firepit - opposite hi king - HYGELAC [50s] - surrounded by a cluster of Geat warriors... ...the great standing stones looming over them like guardians, the firelight already throwing wild shadows... Among the Geat warriors is BRECA [30], almost as sturdy a Beowulf...and, beside him, HONDSCIOH [late 20s], Beowulf' best friend, and sitting to Beowulf's right. All of them have been - and are still - drinking, and eat A short distance away, a group of Geat WOMEN are LAUGHING and TALKING among themselves. (CONTINUED)
20 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 19.

In a game to gut boredom Great Beowulf and Breca... Hondscioh rolls his eyes, snorts derision. Beowulf smiles him.
..-hoisted their hopes on the seething sea...

The whale-road white as the tongues of trolls...
(at Hondscioh / appreciative) Hear that? The tongues of trolls!

-+-again. The roars of LAUGHTER stir the child. Beowulf rises and carries the child to a bed of furs nearby.

20 21 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 21.

A LONGSHIP is being loaded, Beowulf watching over the process. He glances across the dock and sees... .-.-.a row of human HEADS, appearing to be sitting on a board... amongst them Hondscioh, Breca and Thorkel. One o the heads moves, starts speaking. Beowulf recoils a step, then relaxes, seeing the illusion ...the cluster of MEN standing by the boat, their bodies blocked by the dock. Beowulf strolls over to the group. 21 22 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 22.
What - you plan to sing the thing to death? Breca snatches the harp from Hondscioh, hands it to Thork Hondscioh fires a dirty look at Breca, who smirks.
(to Beowulf re Hondscioh / warning) He puts one hand on my harp...

(to Hondscioh) -..I warn you - you're a dead man. Hondscioh gives a mock-shudder. Breca and Beowulf trade a grin. Thorkel does not, placing his precious harp in a rabbit-skin bag. And the loading continues.

Beowulf is slumped at the side of his LONGSHIP as it cuts through the water. TWELVE GEATS are with him [including Breca, Hondscioh and Thorkel], the sail doing all the wor One man is feeding the hearth fire on which meat is cooki

22 23 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 23.

A glass-still channel of water, in which dozens of ICEBER stand... seeming to exude a blue-white light. PUSH IN / FIND: a small boat - an Irish CORACLE - driftin -.-in the aft of which a man in ragged monk's cloak - BRE [40s] - is sprawled, his ratty sail catching the bit of breeze, his hand draped over the rudder. He appears weak sick, his eyes those of a madman, fixed with suspicion on looming ice figures...
(slurred Irish mutter) -.-woe betide you beasts of ice... ogre, troll - I don't wary much... He raises one skinny arm like a weapon.
For I bring the burning sword of Christ! To cleave you thus... and thus... and thus! And he strikes out his arm in the symbol of the cross... before his energy leaves him and his arm drops.

Fine then. Hold your tongues... but dunna think I dunna know your methods and your manner! They say you lie more below than above and on a whim will swing your ice-blue asses up at God. Yesssss, well, do as you must... (CONTINUED)
